Name: Light Scattering by Small Particles (Dover Books on Physics)

ReviewList.Text: This book gives an excellent overview on light scattering by small particles and is a must-have for everybody working on scattering phenomena. Whether you are a phycisist, mathematician or engineer, it provides a solid  basis for the problems encountered. Further comment is not needed - just  consider how often this book is referenced to in scientific publications!
Useful for people that work with scattered light from many types of scattering particles.  Good for a summary and equation viewpoint, less useful if you want a deep derivation.
the is written well it can be use as areference book for light scatteringit contain  numerical examples that can helps to understand the subjects it is relatively unexpansive cost
This was a Father's Day gift for my dear husband. He was really happy to get this. Dear Hubs is a scientist so this is fun reading for him.

okay, this book is highly utilized by a great deal of people in the field, but i find the book lacking in readability. It generalizes far too much. It gives too little detail. It reminds me of an outline for a scattering text book. It is a reference text in the truest sense of the word. It's obvious intent is a reminder for those who already know the information, but it is so generalized...it alone is not very useful for the student learning scattering.
